Package it.unive.lisa.cfg

Class CFG

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unive.lisa.cfg.CFG
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CFGWithAnalysisResults
    public class CFG
extends java.lang.Object
    A control flow graph, that has Statements as nodes and Edges as edges.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  CFG.SemanticFunction<H extends HeapDomain<H>,​V extends ValueDomain<V>>
      A functional interface that can be used for compute the semantics of Statements, producing AnalysisStates.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int DEFAULT_WIDENING_THRESHOLD
      The default number of fixpoint iteration on a given statement after which calls to Lattice.lub(Lattice) gets replaced with Lattice.widening(Lattice).

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_WIDENING_THRESHOLD

        public static final int DEFAULT_WIDENING_THRESHOLD
        The default number of fixpoint iteration on a given statement after which calls to Lattice.lub(Lattice) gets replaced with Lattice.widening(Lattice).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Parameters:

      • CFG

        public CFG​(CFGDescriptor descriptor,
           java.util.Collection<Statement> entrypoints,
           AdjacencyMatrix adjacencyMatrix)
        Builds the control flow graph.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - the descriptor of this cfg
        entrypoints - the statements of this cfg that will be reachable from other cfgs
        adjacencyMatrix - the matrix containing all the statements and the edges that will be part of this cfg

    • Method Detail

      • getDescriptor

        public final CFGDescriptor getDescriptor()
        Yields the name of this control flow graph.
        Returns:
        the name

      • getEntrypoints

        public final java.util.Collection<Statement> getEntrypoints()
        Yields the statements of this control flow graph that are entrypoints, that is, that can be executed from other cfgs. This usually contains the first statement of this cfg, but might also contain other ones.
        Returns:
        the entrypoints of this cfg.

      • getNormalExitpoints

        public final java.util.Collection<Statement> getNormalExitpoints()
        Yields the statements of this control flow graph that are normal exitpoints, that is, that normally ends the execution of this cfg, returning the control to the caller.
        Returns:
        the exitpoints of this cfg.

      • getNodes

        public final java.util.Collection<Statement> getNodes()
        Yields the set of nodes of this control flow graph.
        Returns:
        the collection of nodes

      • getEdges

        public final java.util.Collection<Edge> getEdges()
        Yields the set of edges of this control flow graph.
        Returns:
        the collection of edges

      • addNode

        public final void addNode​(Statement node)
        Adds the given node to the set of nodes, optionally setting that as root. This is equivalent to invoking addNode(Statement, boolean) with false as second parameter.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to add

      • addNode

        public final void addNode​(Statement node,
                          boolean entrypoint)
        Adds the given node to the set of nodes, optionally marking this as entrypoint (that is, reachable executable from other cfgs). The first statement of a cfg should always be marked as entrypoint. Besides, statements that might be reached through jumps from external cfgs should be marked as entrypoints as well.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to add
        entrypoint - if true causes the given node to be considered as an entrypoint.

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge​(Edge edge)
        Adds an edge to this control flow graph.
        Parameters:
        edge - the edge to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the source or the destination of the given edge are not part of this cfg

      • getNodesCount

        public final int getNodesCount()
        Yields the total number of nodes of this control flow graph.
        Returns:
        the number of nodes

      • getEdgesCount

        public final int getEdgesCount()
        Yields the total number of edges of this control flow graph.
        Returns:
        the number of edges

      • getEdgeConnecting

        public final Edge getEdgeConnecting​(Statement source,
                                    Statement destination)
        Yields the edge connecting the two given statements, if any. Yields null if such edge does not exist, or if one of the two statements is not inside this cfg.
        Parameters:
        source - the source statement
        destination - the destination statement
        Returns:
        the edge connecting source to destination, or null

      • followersOf

        public final java.util.Collection<Statement> followersOf​(Statement node)
        Yields the collection of the nodes that are followers of the given one, that is, all nodes such that there exist an edge in this control flow graph going from the given node to such node. Yields null if the node is not in this cfg.
        Parameters:
        node - the node
        Returns:
        the collection of followers

      • predecessorsOf

        public final java.util.Collection<Statement> predecessorsOf​(Statement node)
        Yields the collection of the nodes that are predecessors of the given vertex, that is, all nodes such that there exist an edge in this control flow graph going from such node to the given one. Yields null if the node is not in this cfg.
        Parameters:
        node - the node
        Returns:
        the collection of predecessors

      • dump

        public void dump​(java.io.Writer writer,
                 java.lang.String name)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Dumps the content of this control flow graph in the given writer, formatted as a dot file.
        Parameters:
        writer - the writer where the content will be written
        name - the name of the dot diagraph
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an exception happens while writing something to the given writer

      • dump

        public void dump​(java.io.Writer writer,
                 java.lang.String name,
                 java.util.function.Function<Statement,​java.lang.String> labelGenerator)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Dumps the content of this control flow graph in the given writer, formatted as a dot file. The content of each vertex will be enriched by invoking labelGenerator on the vertex itself, to obtain an extra description to be concatenated with the standard call to the vertex's toString()
        Parameters:
        writer - the writer where the content will be written
        name - the name of the dot diagraph
        labelGenerator - the function used to generate extra labels
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an exception happens while writing something to the given writer

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
        CFG instances use reference equality for equality checks, under the assumption that every cfg is unique. For checking if two cfgs are effectively equal (that is, they are different object with the same structure) use isEqualTo(CFG).

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • isEqualTo

        public boolean isEqualTo​(CFG cfg)
        Checks if this cfg is effectively equal to the given one, that is, if they have the same structure while potentially being different instances.
        Parameters:
        cfg - the other cfg
        Returns:
        true if this cfg and the given one are effectively equals

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • simplify

        public void simplify()
        Simplifies this cfg, removing all NoOps and rewriting the edge set accordingly. This method will throw an UnsupportedOperationException if one of the NoOps has an outgoing edge that is not a SequentialEdge, since such statement is expected to always be sequential.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if there exists at least one NoOp with an outgoing non-sequential edge, or if one of the ingoing edges to the NoOp is not currently supported.

      • fixpoint

        public final <H extends HeapDomain<H>,​V extends ValueDomain<V>> CFGWithAnalysisResults<H,​V> fixpoint​(AnalysisState<H,​V> entryState,
                                                                                                                 CallGraph cg,
                                                                                                                 CFG.SemanticFunction<H,​V> semantics)
                                                                                                          throws FixpointException
        Computes a fixpoint over this control flow graph. This method returns a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance mapping each Statement to the AnalysisState computed by this method. The computation uses Lattice.lub(Lattice) to compose results obtained at different iterations, up to DEFAULT_WIDENING_THRESHOLD * predecessors_number times, where predecessors_number is the number of expressions that are predecessors of the one being processed. After overcoming that threshold, Lattice.widening(Lattice) is used. The computation starts at the statements returned by getEntrypoints(), using entryState as entry state for all of them. cg will be invoked to get the approximation of all invoked cfgs, while a fresh instance of FIFOWorkingSet is used as working set for the statements to process.
        Type Parameters:
        H - the type of HeapDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        V - the type of ValueDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        Parameters:
        entryState - the entry states to apply to each Statement returned by getEntrypoints()
        cg - the callgraph that can be queried when a call towards an other cfg is encountered
        semantics - the CFG.SemanticFunction that will be used for computing the abstract post-state of statements
        Returns:
        a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance that is equivalent to this control flow graph, and that stores for each Statement the result of the fixpoint computation
        Throws:
        FixpointException - if an error occurs during the semantic computation of a statement, or if some unknown/invalid statement ends up in the working set

      • fixpoint

        public final <H extends HeapDomain<H>,​V extends ValueDomain<V>> CFGWithAnalysisResults<H,​V> fixpoint​(AnalysisState<H,​V> entryState,
                                                                                                                 CallGraph cg,
                                                                                                                 int widenAfter,
                                                                                                                 CFG.SemanticFunction<H,​V> semantics)
                                                                                                          throws FixpointException
        Computes a fixpoint over this control flow graph. This method returns a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance mapping each Statement to the AnalysisState computed by this method. The computation uses Lattice.lub(Lattice) to compose results obtained at different iterations, up to widenAfter * predecessors_number times, where predecessors_number is the number of expressions that are predecessors of the one being processed. After overcoming that threshold, Lattice.widening(Lattice) is used. The computation starts at the statements returned by getEntrypoints(), using entryState as entry state for all of them. cg will be invoked to get the approximation of all invoked cfgs, while a fresh instance of FIFOWorkingSet is used as working set for the statements to process.
        Type Parameters:
        H - the type of HeapDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        V - the type of ValueDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        Parameters:
        entryState - the entry states to apply to each Statement returned by getEntrypoints()
        cg - the callgraph that can be queried when a call towards an other cfg is encountered
        widenAfter - the number of times after which the Lattice.lub(Lattice) invocation gets replaced by the Lattice.widening(Lattice) call. Use 0 to always use Lattice.lub(Lattice)
        semantics - the CFG.SemanticFunction that will be used for computing the abstract post-state of statements
        Returns:
        a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance that is equivalent to this control flow graph, and that stores for each Statement the result of the fixpoint computation
        Throws:
        FixpointException - if an error occurs during the semantic computation of a statement, or if some unknown/invalid statement ends up in the working set

      • fixpoint

        public final <H extends HeapDomain<H>,​V extends ValueDomain<V>> CFGWithAnalysisResults<H,​V> fixpoint​(AnalysisState<H,​V> entryState,
                                                                                                                 CallGraph cg,
                                                                                                                 WorkingSet<Statement> ws,
                                                                                                                 CFG.SemanticFunction<H,​V> semantics)
                                                                                                          throws FixpointException
        Computes a fixpoint over this control flow graph. This method returns a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance mapping each Statement to the AnalysisState computed by this method. The computation uses Lattice.lub(Lattice) to compose results obtained at different iterations, up to DEFAULT_WIDENING_THRESHOLD * predecessors_number times, where predecessors_number is the number of expressions that are predecessors of the one being processed. After overcoming that threshold, Lattice.widening(Lattice) is used. The computation starts at the statements returned by getEntrypoints(), using entryState as entry state for all of them. cg will be invoked to get the approximation of all invoked cfgs, while ws is used as working set for the statements to process.
        Type Parameters:
        H - the type of HeapDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        V - the type of ValueDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        Parameters:
        entryState - the entry states to apply to each Statement returned by getEntrypoints()
        cg - the callgraph that can be queried when a call towards an other cfg is encountered
        ws - the WorkingSet instance to use for this computation
        semantics - the CFG.SemanticFunction that will be used for computing the abstract post-state of statements
        Returns:
        a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance that is equivalent to this control flow graph, and that stores for each Statement the result of the fixpoint computation
        Throws:
        FixpointException - if an error occurs during the semantic computation of a statement, or if some unknown/invalid statement ends up in the working set

      • fixpoint

        public final <H extends HeapDomain<H>,​V extends ValueDomain<V>> CFGWithAnalysisResults<H,​V> fixpoint​(AnalysisState<H,​V> entryState,
                                                                                                                 CallGraph cg,
                                                                                                                 WorkingSet<Statement> ws,
                                                                                                                 int widenAfter,
                                                                                                                 CFG.SemanticFunction<H,​V> semantics)
                                                                                                          throws FixpointException
        Computes a fixpoint over this control flow graph. This method returns a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance mapping each Statement to the AnalysisState computed by this method. The computation uses Lattice.lub(Lattice) to compose results obtained at different iterations, up to widenAfter * predecessors_number times, where predecessors_number is the number of expressions that are predecessors of the one being processed. After overcoming that threshold, Lattice.widening(Lattice) is used. The computation starts at the statements returned by getEntrypoints(), using entryState as entry state for all of them. cg will be invoked to get the approximation of all invoked cfgs, while ws is used as working set for the statements to process.
        Type Parameters:
        H - the type of HeapDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        V - the type of ValueDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        Parameters:
        entryState - the entry states to apply to each Statement returned by getEntrypoints()
        cg - the callgraph that can be queried when a call towards an other cfg is encountered
        ws - the WorkingSet instance to use for this computation
        widenAfter - the number of times after which the Lattice.lub(Lattice) invocation gets replaced by the Lattice.widening(Lattice) call. Use 0 to always use Lattice.lub(Lattice)
        semantics - the CFG.SemanticFunction that will be used for computing the abstract post-state of statements
        Returns:
        a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance that is equivalent to this control flow graph, and that stores for each Statement the result of the fixpoint computation
        Throws:
        FixpointException - if an error occurs during the semantic computation of a statement, or if some unknown/invalid statement ends up in the working set

      • fixpoint

        public final <H extends HeapDomain<H>,​V extends ValueDomain<V>> CFGWithAnalysisResults<H,​V> fixpoint​(java.util.Collection<Statement> entrypoints,
                                                                                                                 AnalysisState<H,​V> entryState,
                                                                                                                 CallGraph cg,
                                                                                                                 CFG.SemanticFunction<H,​V> semantics)
                                                                                                          throws FixpointException
        Computes a fixpoint over this control flow graph. This method returns a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance mapping each Statement to the AnalysisState computed by this method. The computation uses Lattice.lub(Lattice) to compose results obtained at different iterations, up to DEFAULT_WIDENING_THRESHOLD * predecessors_number times, where predecessors_number is the number of expressions that are predecessors of the one being processed. After overcoming that threshold, Lattice.widening(Lattice) is used. The computation starts at the statements in entrypoints, using entryState as entry state for all of them. cg will be invoked to get the approximation of all invoked cfgs, while a fresh instance of FIFOWorkingSet is used as working set for the statements to process.
        Type Parameters:
        H - the type of HeapDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        V - the type of ValueDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        Parameters:
        entrypoints - the collection of Statements that to use as a starting point of the computation (that must be nodes of this cfg)
        entryState - the entry states to apply to each Statement in entrypoints
        cg - the callgraph that can be queried when a call towards an other cfg is encountered
        semantics - the CFG.SemanticFunction that will be used for computing the abstract post-state of statements
        Returns:
        a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance that is equivalent to this control flow graph, and that stores for each Statement the result of the fixpoint computation
        Throws:
        FixpointException - if an error occurs during the semantic computation of a statement, or if some unknown/invalid statement ends up in the working set

      • fixpoint

        public final <H extends HeapDomain<H>,​V extends ValueDomain<V>> CFGWithAnalysisResults<H,​V> fixpoint​(java.util.Collection<Statement> entrypoints,
                                                                                                                 AnalysisState<H,​V> entryState,
                                                                                                                 CallGraph cg,
                                                                                                                 int widenAfter,
                                                                                                                 CFG.SemanticFunction<H,​V> semantics)
                                                                                                          throws FixpointException
        Computes a fixpoint over this control flow graph. This method returns a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance mapping each Statement to the AnalysisState computed by this method. The computation uses Lattice.lub(Lattice) to compose results obtained at different iterations, up to widenAfter * predecessors_number times, where predecessors_number is the number of expressions that are predecessors of the one being processed. After overcoming that threshold, Lattice.widening(Lattice) is used. The computation starts at the statements in entrypoints, using entryState as entry state for all of them. cg will be invoked to get the approximation of all invoked cfgs, while a fresh instance of FIFOWorkingSet is used as working set for the statements to process.
        Type Parameters:
        H - the type of HeapDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        V - the type of ValueDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        Parameters:
        entrypoints - the collection of Statements that to use as a starting point of the computation (that must be nodes of this cfg)
        entryState - the entry states to apply to each Statement in entrypoints
        cg - the callgraph that can be queried when a call towards an other cfg is encountered
        widenAfter - the number of times after which the Lattice.lub(Lattice) invocation gets replaced by the Lattice.widening(Lattice) call. Use 0 to always use Lattice.lub(Lattice)
        semantics - the CFG.SemanticFunction that will be used for computing the abstract post-state of statements
        Returns:
        a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance that is equivalent to this control flow graph, and that stores for each Statement the result of the fixpoint computation
        Throws:
        FixpointException - if an error occurs during the semantic computation of a statement, or if some unknown/invalid statement ends up in the working set

      • fixpoint

        public final <H extends HeapDomain<H>,​V extends ValueDomain<V>> CFGWithAnalysisResults<H,​V> fixpoint​(java.util.Collection<Statement> entrypoints,
                                                                                                                 AnalysisState<H,​V> entryState,
                                                                                                                 CallGraph cg,
                                                                                                                 WorkingSet<Statement> ws,
                                                                                                                 CFG.SemanticFunction<H,​V> semantics)
                                                                                                          throws FixpointException
        Computes a fixpoint over this control flow graph. This method returns a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance mapping each Statement to the AnalysisState computed by this method. The computation uses Lattice.lub(Lattice) to compose results obtained at different iterations, up to DEFAULT_WIDENING_THRESHOLD * predecessors_number times, where predecessors_number is the number of expressions that are predecessors of the one being processed. After overcoming that threshold, Lattice.widening(Lattice) is used. The computation starts at the statements in entrypoints, using entryState as entry state for all of them. cg will be invoked to get the approximation of all invoked cfgs, while ws is used as working set for the statements to process.
        Type Parameters:
        H - the type of HeapDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        V - the type of ValueDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        Parameters:
        entrypoints - the collection of Statements that to use as a starting point of the computation (that must be nodes of this cfg)
        entryState - the entry states to apply to each Statement in entrypoints
        cg - the callgraph that can be queried when a call towards an other cfg is encountered
        ws - the WorkingSet instance to use for this computation
        semantics - the CFG.SemanticFunction that will be used for computing the abstract post-state of statements
        Returns:
        a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance that is equivalent to this control flow graph, and that stores for each Statement the result of the fixpoint computation
        Throws:
        FixpointException - if an error occurs during the semantic computation of a statement, or if some unknown/invalid statement ends up in the working set

      • fixpoint

        public final <H extends HeapDomain<H>,​V extends ValueDomain<V>> CFGWithAnalysisResults<H,​V> fixpoint​(java.util.Collection<Statement> entrypoints,
                                                                                                                 AnalysisState<H,​V> entryState,
                                                                                                                 CallGraph cg,
                                                                                                                 WorkingSet<Statement> ws,
                                                                                                                 int widenAfter,
                                                                                                                 CFG.SemanticFunction<H,​V> semantics)
                                                                                                          throws FixpointException
        Computes a fixpoint over this control flow graph. This method returns a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance mapping each Statement to the AnalysisState computed by this method. The computation uses Lattice.lub(Lattice) to compose results obtained at different iterations, up to widenAfter * predecessors_number times, where predecessors_number is the number of expressions that are predecessors of the one being processed. After overcoming that threshold, Lattice.widening(Lattice) is used. The computation starts at the statements in entrypoints, using entryState as entry state for all of them. cg will be invoked to get the approximation of all invoked cfgs, while ws is used as working set for the statements to process.
        Type Parameters:
        H - the type of HeapDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        V - the type of ValueDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        Parameters:
        entrypoints - the collection of Statements that to use as a starting point of the computation (that must be nodes of this cfg)
        entryState - the entry states to apply to each Statement in entrypoints
        cg - the callgraph that can be queried when a call towards an other cfg is encountered
        ws - the WorkingSet instance to use for this computation
        widenAfter - the number of times after which the Lattice.lub(Lattice) invocation gets replaced by the Lattice.widening(Lattice) call. Use 0 to always use Lattice.lub(Lattice)
        semantics - the CFG.SemanticFunction that will be used for computing the abstract post-state of statements
        Returns:
        a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance that is equivalent to this control flow graph, and that stores for each Statement the result of the fixpoint computation
        Throws:
        FixpointException - if an error occurs during the semantic computation of a statement, or if some unknown/invalid statement ends up in the working set

      • fixpoint

        public final <H extends HeapDomain<H>,​V extends ValueDomain<V>> CFGWithAnalysisResults<H,​V> fixpoint​(java.util.Map<Statement,​AnalysisState<H,​V>> startingPoints,
                                                                                                                 CallGraph cg,
                                                                                                                 CFG.SemanticFunction<H,​V> semantics)
                                                                                                          throws FixpointException
        Computes a fixpoint over this control flow graph. This method returns a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance mapping each Statement to the AnalysisState computed by this method. The computation uses Lattice.lub(Lattice) to compose results obtained at different iterations, up to DEFAULT_WIDENING_THRESHOLD * predecessors_number times, where predecessors_number is the number of expressions that are predecessors of the one being processed. After overcoming that threshold, Lattice.widening(Lattice) is used. The computation starts at the statements in startingPoints, using as its entry state their respective value. cg will be invoked to get the approximation of all invoked cfgs, while a fresh instance of FIFOWorkingSet is used as working set for the statements to process.
        Type Parameters:
        H - the type of HeapDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        V - the type of ValueDomain contained into the computed abstract state
        Parameters:
        startingPoints - a map between Statements that to use as a starting point of the computation (that must be nodes of this cfg) and the entry states to apply on it
        cg - the callgraph that can be queried when a call towards an other cfg is encountered
        semantics - the CFG.SemanticFunction that will be used for computing the abstract post-state of statements
        Returns:
        a CFGWithAnalysisResults instance that is equivalent to this control flow graph, and that stores for each Statement the result of the fixpoint computation
        Throws:
        FixpointException - if an error occurs during the semantic computation of a statement, or if some unknown/invalid statement ends up in the working set
